title: X (Twitter) Rules and Policies - Moderation and Free Speech
content:
# X (formerly Twitter) Rules and Policies

## Core Moderation Philosophy
"Freedom of speech, not freedom of reach"

X allows legal speech, even if offensive, controversial, or harmful (including hate speech and misinformation). Content is not removed based on disagreement, but visibility may be limited.

## Content Removal Categories

### 1. Illegal Content (Permanent Suspension)
- Child sexual exploitation material (CSEM)
- Terrorist content and terrorist organization promotion
- Direct threats of violence
- Illegal goods and services

### 2. Spam and Platform Abuse
- Coordinated inauthentic behavior
- Platform manipulation
- Reduced visibility or suspension

### 3. Doxxing and Harassment
- Targeted sharing of private information
- Severe targeted abuse
- Content removal and potential account suspension

### 4. Civic Integrity (Limited Enforcement)
- Election fraud claims (removed only if demonstrably false AND harmful)
- COVID-19 misinformation (policy scaled back post-Musk acquisition)
- Labeling or visibility limits applied

## Algorithm Characteristics

### Transparency
X open-sourced ~1,000 GitHub repositories in March 2023, including recommendation algorithm

### Engagement-Based Ranking
- Positive signals: Likes, replies, reposts, bookmarks (heavily weighted), follows
- Negative signals: Mutes, blocks, "not interested"
- Media boost: Images/videos receive ~2x algorithmic boost
- Premium features: Verified+ users prioritized
- Reply ranking: "Healthy conversation" boosts polite/relevant replies

### Content Prioritization
- Legal content not filtered from algorithm
- Low-engagement spam deprioritized
- "Manipulated media" flagged but not removed
- Unfiltered discourse emphasized

## Enforcement
- Human moderators + AI systems
- Appeals process via @Safety
- Community Notes: Crowd-sourced fact-checking
- Rate limiting to prevent bot abuse (2023+)

## Post-Musk Changes (2022+)
- Reduced trust/safety team by ~80%
- Restored previously suspended accounts (e.g., Trump, Kanye)
- Rate limits introduced
- Premium membership perks for higher reach
- Loosened adult content policy (porn allowed if labeled)

## First Amendment Position
X positions itself as a "public town square" with minimal censorship beyond legal requirements

### First Amendment Reality
- First Amendment protects from *government* censorship, not private platform moderation
- Private platforms have First Amendment rights to moderate
- Visibility limits are not equivalent to bans
- Section 230 shields platforms from liability for user content
- No legal requirement for platforms to be neutral

## Compliance with Local Laws
- EU Digital Services Act
- Brazil regulations
- Other jurisdictional requirements
